eng: of; -'s; genitive; denotes modifier or associate (RELATIVE:whose)
than; as; partitive; denotes amount or degree (COMPLEMENT:amount; number; quantity; extent; magnitude|RELATIVE:the amout that)
sbj; by; agentive; denotes subject, agent, or force (COMPLEMENT:subject|RELATIVE:who|REFLEXIVE:themself)
obj; on; to; absolutive; denotes direct object, patient, or experiencer (COPMLEMENT:direct object|RELATIVE:which|REFLEXIVE:itself)
ind; to; by; objective; denotes indirect object, theme, stimulus, or recipient (COMPLEMENT:indirect object|RELATIVE:whom|REFLEXIVE:whichself)
at; on; in; dative; denotes time (COMPLEMENT:time; date; instance|RELATIVE:when|VERB:be at; coincide; OBJ happens at the same time as IND)
on; at; in; locative; denotes location (COMPLEMENT:location; place|RELATIVE:where|VERB:be present; be; OBJ is present at IND)
with; through; by; instrumental; denotes instrument (COMPLEMENT:tool; medium; instrument|RELATIVE:with which|VERB:use; work through; SBJ uses OBJ)
for; so; to; purposive; denotes purpose, goal, or beneficiary (COMPLEMENT:purpose; end; justification|RELATIVE:for which)
because; since; causal; denotes cause (COMPLEMENT:cause; inciting event; agent|RELATIVE:because of which)

eng: if; for; conditional; denotes hypothetical world (COMPLEMENT:condition; world|RELATIVE:for which)
by; as; via; instructive; denotes method or manner (COMPLEMENT:method; way; path; manner|RELATIVE:by which)
